segments.text: I notice the boy stretching for the cookie jar, balancing on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s going to fall, and that stool is going to go flying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share, like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the counter, and the woman doesn’t even glance at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is turning into a lake, and she’s just polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open window lets in so much light, but inside, it’s pure madness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to hurt himself, and no one is paying attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and they’re still going for more.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s apron is going to be ruined by that water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is the most chaotic kitchen scene I’ve ever seen.
segments.speaker: PAR
